This plugin checks your Figma designs and highlights potential issues before uploading them as templates into Frontify. Itâ€™s designed to improve your template creation and management experience â€” making the integration between Figma and Frontify more seamless.


Issues

Weâ€™re continuously refining and expanding the list of checks. This initial release focuses on the most common issues, with more to come. As we improve template import capabilities, some checks may also be retired.


  1. Auto-layout frames

plugins.name: Layer Name Lister
plugins.description:
A Figma plugin that provides a hierarchical view of selected layers and their children. This plugin makes it easy to copy layer names with their complete hierarchy or simple structure for documentation, handoff, or reference purposes.


Also pretty useful if the layers need to be fed to an LLM for cross checking against a checklist of fields that need to be included in the UI (that's why I developed this plugin)


Features

- Recursive Layer Traversal: Lists all selected layers and recursively shows their children

- Multiple Output Formats:

- Full Paths: Shows complete hierarchical paths of each layer

- Simple Names: Shows only the layer names without parent paths

- JSON Format: Structured data format including layer IDs, types, and hierarchy

- Cycle Detection: Avoids infinite loops with automatic cycle detection

- Copy to Clipboard: One-click copy of the entire layer hierarchy

- Live Updates: Automatically updates when selection changes

- Resizable Interface: Adjust the plugin window size to your needs

- Performance Optimized: Handles large layer structures efficiently with batch processing


Outputs

Full Paths (Default)

Frame 1
Frame 1 / Button
Frame 1 / Button / Label
Frame 1 / Button / Icon
Frame 1 / Content
Frame 1 / Content / Title
Frame 1 / Content / Description


Simple Names

Frame 1
Button
Label
Icon
Content
Title
Description


JSON Format

[
{
"id": "1:2",
"name": "Frame 1",
"type": "FRAME",
"path": "Frame 1",
"level": 0,
"children": [
{
"id": "1:3",
"name": "Button",
"type": "INSTANCE",
"path": "Frame 1 / Button",
"level": 1,
"children": [...]
},
...
]
}
]
plugins.tagline: A plugin that will give you a plain text list of the layers you have selected (incl. children)

plugins.name: Calculator
plugins.description:
A handy Figma plugin designed to accelerate your workflow by instantly calculating totals from numerical values in text layers. Whether you're working on financial interfaces, data tables, or statistical visualizations, this tool ensures accuracy and efficiency with minimal effort.


How It Works:


Automatic Number Detection:

Quickly detects and extracts numbers from your selected text layers, effortlessly handling various formats:

  1. Simple numbers: 1234
  2. Decimal numbers: 1234.56 or 1234,56
  3. Numbers with thousand separators: 1,234.56 or 1.234,56


Real-Time Calculation:

Instantly calculates and displays the total sum of all detected numbers from your selected layers. Update your selection, and the total recalculates automatically.


Detailed View:

Offers an expandable detailed view showing each processed text layer along with its extracted numeric value, making it easy to verify and manage your data.


Key Features:


Real-Time Updates: Automatically refreshes calculations as your selection changes.

Adaptive Interface: Collapses the detailed view when no layers are selected, keeping your workspace clean.

Theme Support: Fully compatible with both light and dark Figma themes for optimal visibility.

Native Integration: Utilizes Figmaâ€™s native UI components for a seamless experience.


Who Is It For?


This plugin is ideal for designers who frequently handle numerical data within their designs. By automating the calculation process, it allows you to save valuable time and focus more on the creative aspects of your projects, enhancing productivity and accuracy.
plugins.tagline: Select text layers, instantly calculate their numerical values in real time.

plugins.name: Copy Paste Overrides
plugins.description: A tiny tool that does exactly as described. Useful when working with nested instances. Let's say you have a component that contains a list of items. You are working in an instance of that component and want to switch item 1 with item 2 on the list. You cannot do that because reordering of items is not supported within an instance. But what you can do is just copy and paste the overrides from item 1 to item 2 and vice versa. You're welcome!

119945.name: Copy Paste Overrides
119945.description: A tiny tool that does exactly as described. Useful when working with nested instances. Let's say you have a component that contains a list of items. You are working in an instance of that component and want to switch item 1 with item 2 on the list. You cannot do that because reordering of items is not supported within an instance. But what you can do is just copy and paste the overrides from item 1 to item 2 and vice versa. You're welcome!
119945.release_notes:
You can copy and paste overrides for component properties from one instance onto another.

Known limitations:
- nested instances don't fully work
- only overrides for specified properties are copied (for example a text that is changed without it being a property won't be copied)

plugins.name: Figma Frame History
plugins.description:
This tool enables version-controlled frame history management directly on the page. It offers four key commands:


â€¢ Major Version: Select a BASE NODE on the page and execute this command. A NEW NODE will be created right after the BASE NODE, with a version control suffix in its name (e.g., Frame_1.0 â†’ Frame_v2.0).


â€¢ Minor Version: Similar to the **Major Version** command, but only the minor version number is incremented by 1 (e.g., Frame_1.0 â†’ Frame_v1.1).


â€¢ Unlock History: This command unlocks all previously locked frames in the history, restoring them to their default style.


â€¢ Lock History: This command locks all history frames again, making them transparent.


If the BASE NODE name does not include a version control suffix _${majorVersion}.${minorVersion}, the NEW NODE name will default to ${baseNodeName}_v1.0 when either the Major Version or Minor Version command is executed.

accepted.description:

Quickly convert your Figma variables into clean JSON with Variable JSON. Select your Collection, Group, and Mode, generate the JSON, and copy it instantlyâ€”perfect for streamlining design-to-development workflows.


How to Use:

  1. Open Variable JSON: In Figma, go to Plugins > Variable JSON.
  2. Select Variables: Choose the Collection, Group, and Mode (e.g., Light, Dark, or Custom).
  3. Generate JSON: Click "GEN JSON" to create the JSON output based on your selection.
  4. Copy JSON: Click copy button and use it in your projects.

plugins.name: Avctoris Copyright
plugins.description:
The Avctoris Copyright plugin for Figma is a comprehensive tool designed to help creators protect and manage their intellectual property rights effortlessly. With this plugin, users can seamlessly generate a PDF certificate of their design work directly from their Figma workspace, ensuring that their creations are legally safeguarded.


Key Features:


Automated PDF Generation: Export your design assets into a PDF format for easy documentation and protection.

Intellectual Property Management: Record detailed information about the authors and holders of rights for each creation.

Secure Registration: Easily submit your work for copyright registration and receive a certificate, ensuring your designs are legally protected.

User-Friendly Interface: Intuitive UI integrated into Figma, allowing for a smooth and seamless experience.

Real-Time Collaboration: Continue collaborating on designs while managing copyrights without leaving Figma.
plugins.tagline: Where Ideas Come to Life

plugins.name: PrevGen
plugins.description:
PREVGEN - MICROSTOCK PREVIEW GENERATOR

=======================================


ðŸŽ¯ WHAT IS PREVGEN?

PrevGen is a specialized Figma plugin designed exclusively for microstock creators who need to generate hundreds of design previews quickly and efficiently. Stop spending hours creating mockups one by one - automate your entire preview generation workflow.


âš¡ HOW IT WORKS:

1. CREATE TEMPLATE

- Design your preview template in Figma

- Use built-in templates (Freepik, Envato, DepositPhotos formats)

- Mark container layers for your designs


2. UPLOAD DESIGNS

- Drag & drop PNG, JPG, SVG files

- Auto-trim PNG transparency (optional)

- Batch process multiple files


3. CONFIGURE LAYOUT

- Choose: Horizontal, Vertical, or Grid layout

- Auto-spacing and alignment

- Fit or Fill image scaling options


4. CUSTOMIZE CONTENT

- Auto-replace text with filenames

- Apply custom colors to layers

- Bulk background color changes


5. GENERATE PREVIEWS

- Mass generate all previews instantly

- Auto-naming with prefix/suffix options

- Perfect positioning and spacing


âœ¨ KEY FEATURES:

===============

- TEMPLATE SYSTEM - Built-in templates for major microstock platforms

- BATCH PROCESSING - Upload and process multiple designs at once

- AUTO LAYOUT - Smart positioning with customizable spacing

- TEXT AUTOMATION - Auto-replace text layers with design names

- COLOR MAPPING - Apply custom colors to specific layers

- PNG OPTIMIZATION - Auto-trim transparent areas

- FLEXIBLE SCALING - Fit or Fill image modes

- BULK OPERATIONS - Generate hundreds of previews in one click


ðŸŽ¨ SUPPORTED FORMATS:

====================

- PNG (with transparency trimming)

- JPG/JPEG


ðŸ“ BUILT-IN TEMPLATES:

=====================

- Freepik: Landscape (4500Ã—3000), Portrait (3000Ã—4500), Square (3500Ã—3500)

- Envato Elements: Main Image (2340Ã—1560), Secondary (2340Ã—1500)

- DepositPhotos: Landscape (4500Ã—3000), Portrait (3000Ã—4500), Square (3500Ã—3500)


ðŸš€ PERFECT FOR:

===============

- Stock designers creating portfolio previews

- Microstock contributors preparing submissions

- Design agencies showcasing client work

- Freelancers building presentation materials

- Anyone needing bulk design mockups


ðŸ’¡ USE CASES:

=============

- Create portfolio previews for Shutterstock, Adobe Stock, Getty Images

- Generate client presentation mockups

- Build design showcase galleries

- Prepare submission previews for stock platforms

- Automate repetitive design tasks


ðŸŽ¯ WHO BENEFITS:

===============

- Microstock photographers and designers

- Stock content contributors

- Digital design agencies

- Freelance graphic designers

- Portfolio creators


ðŸ’ PRICING:

===========

100% FREE for microstock creators and designers

No hidden fees, no subscriptions, no limitations


ðŸ› ï¸ TECHNICAL SPECS:

==================

- Works with Figma Desktop and Web

- No external dependencies

- Processes files locally (secure)

- Supports unlimited file uploads

- Auto-saves plugin settings


ðŸ“ž SUPPORT & CONTACT:

====================

- Bug Reports: yasadesign.work@gmail.com


ðŸ’– SUPPORT DEVELOPMENT:

======================

Love PrevGen? Support continued development:

PayPal


Thanks for

YASA Design Studio

plugins.name: Import large image(s)
plugins.description:
When posting full page screenshots into FigJam, the images would be blurry and unreadable because Figma automatically reduces image sizes when the height or width is over 4096px. Not anymore!


As a workaround, this plugin

  1. slices the original image into multiple images
  2. groups the sliced images together to create one cohesive image


What makes this plugin different from the others?

  1. The ability to import multiple images at once


If you like it, buy me a beer ðŸ»
plugins.tagline: Import large image(s) into Figma and Figjam, maintaining resolution and size.

plugins.name: Conjure - AI based text generator
plugins.description:
Introduction


Use your OpenAI API key with this plugin to quickly generate text for your designs. The plugin can allows to generate multiple text layers based on the content. Furthermore, it can also group the layers by their names, allowing you to use the layer names in the prompt to further elaborate how you want the data to be filled in.


How to use


The plugin was primarily created for 2 use cases:


1. Generate variations of a single type of data:

  1. Select all the text layers that show the same type of data and you want to generate variations of it. Imagine Name, City, Stock price, etc.
  2. Make sure 'Group by layer name' is OFF.
  3. Add details to the prompt to explain the type of content you want to be generated for the selected fields. Giving examples and formatting is also helpful.
  4. Click generate and it will fill the information!



2. Generate variations of multiple types of data:

  1. Select all the frames or components that you want to fill using this plugin.
  2. Turn ON 'Group by layer name'. The plugin will show you the layer names found.
  3. Add details to the prompt to explain the type of content you want to be generated for the selected fields. You can use the layer names to add specific context. Giving examples and formatting is also helpful.
  4. Click generate and it will fill the information!


3. Generated related data

You can use the group by layer name to select singular text layers which are related. An example is when you need text for First name, Last name, DoB, role, location and relatives. The plugin will try to generate related content for these layers.


Note


1. This plugin needs an OpenAI API Key to work.

2. I will recommend naming your text layers appropriately if you plan to use the Group by layer name feature. You can use it without naming the layers, but sometimes this might result in unexpected results.
plugins.tagline: OpenAI powered text generator with batch text generation feature
